grimoire.preface: Fyvrianism is the magic of the earth, of green and growing, of pale and dying things, of the cycles of growth and decay that underlie the natural world. The base of Fyvria is fertile earth, where life swarms in its endless struggle to survive and prosper.

spell.name: Verdant Hand
spell.description: Greatly accelerates the normal growth of a living plant, causing it to undergo a month of growth over the course of the day. Food and water requirement for the plant are increased by a similar amount.

spell.name: Putrid Hand
spell.description: Causes dead organic matter up to size five to begin rotting at a greatly accelerated rate. While the spell is in effect, the material will decay at 100 times normal speed. Undead corpses get a will roll to resist the spell, but are otherwise still affected.

spell.name: Figure of Aestras
spell.boost: +40 All plants in range can be affected
spell.description: Cause a single plant to grow in a chosen configuration. The magic lasts for the lifetime of the plant, gradually shaping it into its desired form.

spell.name: Balm of Gresan
spell.boost: +40 Allows a second first aid roll
spell.description: When cast on an injured target, gives +3 to the first aid roll. Does not grant a second first aid roll for the target if one has previously been made.

spell.name: Hand of Iliam
spell.description: Prevents a touched wound from becoming infected. It stops bleeding and any potential worsening of the wound. If the wound is already infected, then it has no effect. Can be considered similar to a first aid attempt on the wound, though there is no chance of healing a body level. Note that the magic only seals and cleans the wound and does not have any long term effect beyond this. If the wound is reopened it may possibly be infected, though it is unlikely.

spell.name: Takara's Curse
spell.description: Causes a single open wound to become infected. If the spell is not resisted, then the target must make a stamina roll each day at difficulty 20, modified by normal wound penalty. Failure means the wound worsens by one level. The wound remains infected until the target dies, or the wound is purged of the infection.

spell.name: Favrin's Bar
spell.description: An enchantment which causes a single item of wood to expand, primarily across the grain. The effect is most dramatic with green or living wood. Seasoned wood expands by 15%, green wood by 30% and living wood by 60%. The wood is generally weakened by the change. A target up to size 12 can be affected.

spell.name: Nurture of Isla
spell.description: A spell to increase the healing rate of a wound suffered by a living creature. They get a +12 bonus for their next natural healing roll. Only one casting of this spell will work on a target at any one time.

spell.name: Power of Sharadorn
spell.description: A spell to temporarily increase one of the caster's physical attributes (strength, stamina, agility or dexterity) by one point. It cannot be combined with any other attribute enhancing spell (including itself, even if different spells are affecting different attributes).

spell.name: Dream of Galega
spell.description: Causes a single living creature to fall into a deep slumber. Each night they sleep, they get one natural healing roll (instead of getting one at the end of each week). The creature will naturally awaken the morning after they become fully healed. This spell can be combined with spells such as Nurture of Isla.

spell.name: Mankor's Curse
spell.boost: +60 Affects all designated creatures in near of target
spell.description: A spell to induce a unique wasting disease in a single creature. The victim suffers -10 to all healing (including first aid) and fatigue recovery rolls (including sleep). If cast multiple times on a target, then only the worst effect applies.

spell.name: Eye of Perfection
spell.boost: +30 Know all things about the target
spell.description: Analyses the health of a single living creature, informing the caster of the nature of the worst injury the target is suffering from.

spell.name: Syncope of Shalor
spell.description: Causes a single target up to size 6 to fall asleep if they fail their stamina resistance roll. Higher castings of this spell may affect multiple targets up to the total size that may be affected.

spell.name: Balm of Herl
spell.description: Transfers a disease, infection or other natural ailment (not a wound) from one living creature to another living creature. Both make stamina rolls to resist, and the spell fails unless they are both failed. Neither creature can be greater than size 6.

spell.name: Arbad's Wounding
spell.description: This spell causes the skin and flesh on a living target to rupture, causing one body level of damage if the target fails to resist.

spell.name: Regenesis
spell.description: Regenesis greatly accelerates the healing of living things. While the spell is being maintained, the target creature will get a natural healing roll every eight hours. The Shek-Pvar must keep the spell up over at least an eight hour period while her target rests or sleeps. The process is fatiguing however, five fatigue levels are gained by the target during the period, reduced by one per point of stamina. Versions of this spell which regenerate limbs do so very slowly. Even a lost hand will take about 15 days. Dead matter, even if it can be regenerated, can never be restored to life.

spell.name: Vine of Alguinas
spell.boost: +15 Centre of affect can be up to range near
+30 Can be cast on thorny/non-succulent plants
spell.description: This spells causes very rapid growth in succulent vines. All plants within range begin growing to form a clump of tough, tangled vines, branches and roots. After three rounds, the plants have reached about ten times normal size, they will die. The plants will have rotted back within about half an hour. Though the Shek-Pvar is at the centre of the area when it begins to grow, he generally does have time to get clear if he so wishes.

spell.name: Animus of Nithri
spell.boost: +20 If the zombie has muscles, it can be commanded to move, though control is literal and very difficult
+40 Zombie can be given simple directions
+80 Zombie can be given tasks, such as to fight or follow
spell.description: Animus of Nithri restores a small portion of a dead creature's animus, effectively creating a zombie. It cannot be used on a creature who has had buriel rites performed on it, since it requires a portion of the dead creature's soul to be present in the corpse. The basic spell is enough to activate the memories and (if they are still functional) vocal cords of the dead creature. Memories decay with time. Intelligence and will both drop by a point after a day, a week, and then each month after that, down to a minimum of one.

spell.name: Regrowth of Evala
spell.boost: +20 Only 25% of the original is required
+40 Only 10% of the original is required
+80 Only 5% of the original is required
spell.description: This spell regrows a complete organism from a part of it. For the basic spell, 50% of the organism must be present in order to regrow the whole. It can be used to regrow lost body parts, restore corpses or recover a plant. Dead organisms are not restored to life.

spell.name: Silme's Ward
spell.boost: +20 Caster is alerted as to general nature of intruder
+40 Specific information about intruders are known, limited by sense of the target
+80 Caster may limit what type of intruders raise an alarm
spell.description: When cast upon a living plant or creature, the Shek-Pvar will be alerted if the target perceives another living creature. It is generally used as a alarm. The Shek'Pvar must be within medium range of the target if she is to hear the alarm. The perceptive range of most plants is about three metres. The warning is via a mind link to the Shek-Pvar.

spell.name: Succor of Blezil
spell.description: This spell will heal either disease or injury in a living creature. If used to heal a disease, then the disease is completely healed, and the creature gains from one to five points of long term fatigue, depending on the severity of the disease. If used to heal injuries, then up to six body levels are immediately healed, and converted to long term fatigue. If the target cannot gain more fatigue, then there is no effect. It cannot be used to regenerate lost body parts.

spell.name: Passage of Chabar
spell.boost: +40 Organic clothing and equipment is affected
spell.description: This spell enables the caster to melt through earth, stone or wood, though not other substances. The caster can move through earth at one quarter walking speed, through wood at a fifth speed, and through stone at one tenth speed. If the caster is inside a solid object when the spell stops, then she is instantly killed. Clothes and equipment are unaffected, so only her naked body can travel this way.

spell.name: Vessel of Galanda
spell.range:
Special None Special +20 Takes 42 days to grow +40 Takes 35 days to grow +80 Takes 28 days to grow
This spell grows an adult body from a dead embryo or foetus, though it only works on mammals. The foetus must have been dead at least six hours, and no more than 24 hours when the spell is begun. It takes about ten hours of casting initially to start the spell, and the foetus must be kept in clean water and finely sifted earth. Each day, the growing body consumes about 200 litres of water and 100kg of earth, and the caster must spend about 4 hours with the body. After 56 days, the body is a fully grown adult, and is ready to receive a spirit. It will die within a few hours if a spirit does not inhabit it.

spell.name: Essence of Sinad
spell.description: This spell halts all biological aging in the Shek-Pvar. It requires a transfusion of one litre of blood from a Sindarin or other immortal species. The caster will stop aging for 1 year. However, one point of stamina and strength is lost permanently.

spell.name: Touch of Ptaris
spell.resist:
Will Momentary +25 Range is near +50 Final form can be wood or earth. Earth tends to crumble, so is usually fatal
This spell turns an organic target up to size 12 to stone. The target is still capable of thought, though at greatly reduced rate.
